title: About cooperation
text:
I’m eager to collaborate on projects within my areas of expertise, which encompass statistical methodology, survey data, and political science. If you have any proposals or opportunities for collaboration, please feel free to reach out to me via email. I’m always open to discussing potential projects and partnerships.
If you’d like to get in touch, feel free to email me.

title: My Projects
text:
COMPARING BAYESIAN APPROACHES TO EXPLORATORY FACTOR ANALYSIS | Research Project  | 2023-ongoing
Contributed to a comparative study of R packages for Bayesian exploratory factor analysis (EFA), aiming to evaluate their performance and underlying assumptions. The project supports the development of a robust framework for future simulation-based validation of BEFA methods. Co-authoring a research paper based on the study’s findings.
COMBINING DIGITAL TRACE DATA AND SURVEY DATA FOR PARTICIPATION PREDICTION | Thesis Project | 2023-2024
Investigated integration of digital trace and survey data, specifically addressing bias from selective participation. Explored sources of bias and analyzed data enrichment techniques that allow to enhance accuracy and inclusiveness of demographic groups typically underrepresented in survey research.

title: My Projects
text:

title: My Projects
text:
Political Science
YOUTH INDOCTRINATION: WILL IT ACHIEVE LOYALTY OR HATRED? | Research Project  | 2023 - ongoing
This project investigates the effects of state-driven propaganda in schools on youth political attitudes and values. Using a quasi-experimental design, We examine how exposure to soft propaganda influences political trust, civic engagement, and nationalist sentiments among adolescents. More can be found here.
TECHNOLOGICAL ILLIBERALISM: ELECTORAL CONSEQUENCES | Research Project  | 2024 - 2025
Analyzed how digital infrastructure and emergency-era policies affect electoral outcomes in authoritarian contexts, using data on online voting in Russia. Co-authored a working paper on youth political attitudes and state-led digital securitization, available here.
REPLICATION STUDY OF INEQUALITY TRAP BY ERIK USLANER | Research Project  | 2021 - 2022
Replicated Uslaner’s findings on the links between inequality, corruption, and generalized trust using recent waves of the World Values Survey and European Social Survey. Results matched the original study. Project results are available here.
STRATEGIES OF PARLIAMENTARY PARTIES | Study Project  | 2021 - 2022
I analyzed the recent trends in centralized autocratic party formation using data from the 2021 Russian elections. You can find the paper on this analysis in the Russian Politics journal, available here.
COMPARATIVE ELECTORAL STUDIES | Study Project  | 2019 - 2020
I prepared and analysed electoral data on Switzerland and Ireland with R.F. Turovsky. Electoral ballots are published on the site of the Laboratory for Regional Research , available here.

title: Ilya Fominykh
text:
Greetings! I’m Ilya Fominykh, a researcher specializing in statistics and quantitative methods for the social sciences. My work focuses on survey data analysis, digital trace data, and quasi-experimental designs. I am particularly interested in electoral behavior, value change, and other topics at the intersection of individual dynamics and societal trends.
Welcome to my portfolio, where you can explore my academic and applied research in data-driven social science.


UTRECHT UNIVERSITY, UTRECHT | MSc in Methodology and Statistics for the Behavioural, Biomedical and Social Sciences | Track: Applied Data Science | 2022-2024
Focused on clustering, machine learning, and analysis of both high- and low-dimensional data. Thesis examined error sources in survey data linked to donated digital trace data, developing methods to reduce bias from selective participation.
HIGHER SCHOOL OF ECONOMICS, MOSCOW | BSc in Political Science | Track: Political Analysis | 2018-2022
Graduated with honors (GPA: 8.9). Specialized in quantitative methods, including multilevel modeling, time-series analysis, and structural equation modeling.
VCIOM SOCIOLOGIC SCHOOL, MOSCOW | Winter School | Track: Policy and Market Analysis | 2022
Focused on advanced survey design and data collection methodologies, with practical applications to policy evaluation and market research.
DULWICH COLLEGE, LONDON | Summer School | Track: Global Young Leaders | 2017
Graduated with honors (A). Engaged in interdisciplinary study of international relations, communication, and economics, developing strong analytical and leadership skills.



Business Analyst | Data Analytics Department | Dec 2024 - Ongoing | BartsParts B.V.
I lead the end-to-end development of automated, data-driven solutions using Microsoft Fabric, Azure, and Power BI. My responsibilities include integrating and transforming data from multiple sources, designing scalable pipelines, and delivering near real-time dashboards that support strategic decision-making across departments. I collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data gaps and enhance operational efficiency.
Junior Business Analyst | Data Analytics Department | June 2024 - Dec 2024 | BartsParts B.V.
Developed automated dashboards and pricing policy reports within the Microsoft Fabric environment. Unified disparate databases using SQL, sparkR, PySpark, and DAX, enabling real-time analytics for business operations and reporting.
Research Assistant | Department of Methodology and Statistics | Sept 2023 - June 2024 | Utrecht University
I explored packages for Bayesian exploratory factor analysis currently available in R and prepared a framework for a simulation study.
Teaching Assistant | Department of Methodology and Statistics | Aug 2023 | Utrecht University
I helped summer school students to understand foundations of survey-based research & master basic R usage for survey data analysis.
Research Assistant | Department of Politics and Governance | Feb 2022 - Sept 2022 | Higher School of Economics
Contributed to a research project examining the impact of COVID-19 on political bargaining processes. Responsibilities included advanced data wrangling, cleaning, and integration of multiple datasets; conducting quantitative analysis using R and Python.
Trainee Researcher | Ronald F. Inglehart Laboratory for Comparative Social Research | Feb 2021 - Feb 2022 | Higher School of Economics
Sourced and curated relevant quantitative indicators, performed extensive data wrangling and preprocessing. Conducted statistical analysis and structural equation modeling (SEM) to replicate and validate Uslaner’s “Inequality Trap” study.
Junior Analyst | Holding “Minchenko Consulting” | Jul 2020 - Feb 2022 | Analytic Department
Conducted comprehensive analysis of media representation of spouses of Russian high-ranking officials across social and traditional media platforms. Developed typologies of self-representation strategies grounded in qualitative and quantitative data.
Teaching Assistant | Department of Higher Mathematics | Oct 2020 - Jun 2021 | Higher School of Economics
Checked the control papers of first-year students, conducted consultations on basic R, LaTeX and probability theory topics.
Teaching Assistant | Department of Politics and Governance | Oct 2020 - Jun 2021 | Higher School of Economics
Provided consultations on subjects within the domains of political theory and political philosophy.



Kozlov, V., Romanov, D., Balalaeva, D., & Fominykh, I. (2025). Youth indoctrination in Russia: Will it achieve loyalty or hatred? Available at SSRN 5264533.
Petrov, K., Fominykh, I., Bakshuk, M., Ahalian, A., & Krasnikov, A. (2024). The rise of tech illiberalism in Russia: E-voting and new dimensions of securitization. Journal of Illiberalism Studies, 4(3), 51–71.
Romanov, D., Fominykh, I., & Ankudinov, I. (2023). Substituting the Opposition under Electoral Authoritarianism: The Case of the Russian Regional Parliamentary Elections in 2021. Russian Politics, 8(4), 519-549.
Fominykh I. G., Petrov K. Y. (2021) Spouses of Russian Governors and Their Self-Representation Strategies: Celebrities or Housewives? Monitoring of Public Opinion: Economic and Social Changes, (5), 138–162. (In Russ.)



ODISSEI Conference for Computational Social Science | Presenter | 2024 | Utrecht, Netherlands
2nd Conference “New Advances in the Political Economy of Development in Eurasia” | Presenter | 2024 | Almaty, Kazakhstan



Statistical & Data Analysis
• R/sparkR (tidyverse, brms, lavaan, semTools, mice, ggplot2, Shiny) • Python/Pyspark (pandas, numpy, matplotlib, scikit-learn) • SQL (MySQL, SQLite) • DAX, PowerQuery, Git, SPSS, Mplus
Data Visualization & BI Tools
• Power BI • Microsoft Fabric • Python/R visualizations
Cloud & Workflow Tools
• Microsoft Azure (Data Lake, Data Engineering, Data Factory) • LaTeX (Overleaf) • Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)



• Utrecht Excellence Scholarship recipient | 2022-2024
• Student’s olympiad “Higher League” winner - “Politics, Economics, Philosophy” track | 2021
• Top-2 student rating of the Political Science programme, twice | 2018-2019
• Personal scholarship of the Moscow Government | 2018-2019
